forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 36. Southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 2pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 59. Southwest wind 6 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock ticked past three in the morning, Boston lay cloaked in a tranquil darkness, the city lights sparkling like distant stars on an otherwise calm night. The air is crisp, whispering promises of a cool dawn, where the temperature slips to a comfortable chill around thirty-six degrees. The gentle southwest breeze tugs at the edges of the evening, a mere prelude to the unfolding day. 

As morning wanes, expect the clouds to gather, their grey tendrils hinting at rainfall after two in the afternoon. A modest warmth will emerge, coaxing the temperatures into the upper fifties. For those venturing out, it would be wise to layer your clothing wisely—a comforting sweater or light jacket will serve your needs, and perhaps a sturdy umbrella could be a prudent companion as the clouds tease with damp promises. 

Consider a leisurely stroll through the less crowded streets of the city, perhaps pausing at a cozy café for a warm drink as you watch the world awaken. With the potential for rain later, enjoy these moments of serenity, where the picturesque blend of fog and city life brushes against your senses, inviting contemplation before the day's rhythm asserts itself. Savor the understated beauty of this November day, as the skies shift ever so slightly, hinting at the all-too-familiar embrace of the season.
